items.sentence: Don\'t you want us to go to Boston with you?
Don\'t you want us to take you home with us?
I think you should add a little more pepper.
I thought Tom would be thrilled to see Mary.
Tom wants to stay with us until next Monday.
Tom was a butcher in Boston for three years.
Tom\'s appointment is effective immediately.
We\'re having a three-day weekend this week.
We\'re now on our way to the airport by car.
What makes you think Tom doesn\'t like Mary?
Tom doesn\'t exactly have an airtight alibi.
Tom doesn\'t feel like working this morning.
You said you wanted proof. Well, here it is.
Tom works at a museum not too far from here.
Tom tried to kiss me, but I didn\'t let him.
Why don\'t you come over for dinner tonight?
I\'ll never forget what you\'ve done for me.
I want to become better at managing my time.
I hope they can reach a peaceful compromise.
I can\'t stand the smell of cigarette smoke.
